availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: R. C. Prather (Fulton County, Ky, farmer and prov govt)

body.p: Fulton County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Martha J. Prather. Father of Charles G. Prather, Thomas A. Prather, George B. Prather, John W. Prather, Richard C. Prather, Hugh L. Prather, and Edward J. B. Prather. Owned two enslaved persons in Fulton County in 1850. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Fulton County in 1860. Farmer in Fulton County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
